titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Paul Myron Wentworth Linebarger Papers, 1889-1939
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Diaries, correspondence, speeches and writings, notes, printed matter, and photographs, relating to political conditions in China and to Sun Yat-sen.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Paul Myron Wentworth Linebarger Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1982.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Naperville College and Lake Forest University
Author, Chinese Chances Through Europe's War
Author, Sun Yat-sen and the Chinese Republic
Author, Our Common Cause With China Against Imperialism and Communism
Author, The Maker of Modern China and His Three Principles
Author, La Chin e Navree, Es Espana otra China?

scopecontent.p: Diaries and travel journals, arranged in chronological order.
Biographical sketches, records, memoranda, and scrapbooks of newspaper clippings and articles related to the career of Paul M.W. Linebarger, arranged by physical form.

did.unittitle: Appointment as Legal Adviser to Nationalist Government, China, 1930
Financial records, 1910-1938 - Bank statements, taxes, rent, real estate sales and purchases

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

scopecontent.p: Manuscripts, notes, drafts, printed copies of the writings of Paul M.W. Linebarger, arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: "Asia At Our Gates", two carbon copies, n.d.
"Bandit-Communist Suppression in China Through Silver Welfare (Min-sheng) Loans", typescript, n.d.
"Be True to Your Fate," typescript, n.d.
"China, A Government by Men", carbon copy, n.d.

"China's Mixed Courts", one typescript, one carbon copy, n.d.
"Chinese Banks for America Program", one carbon copy, n.d.
"Chinese Interpretative Lyrics", one typescript, one draft, n.d.
"Daniel Dares, A Romance of Travel", typescript, n.d.
"Foreign Job Holding in China", carbon copy, n.d.
"The Founder of the Chinese Republic", carbon copy, n.d.
"If Sun Were Still Alive", carbon copy, n.d.

"Obstacles of the Unequal Treaties Enough to Frustrate Average Revolutionary Leader", carbon copy, n.d.

"When Japan Is Ready", two typescript copies, n.d.
"With the American Concentration in the Philippines", typescript, n.d.

"Chinese Verses and Other Notes", holograph, ca. 1920
"The Entourage of Dr. Sun", one typescript, two carbon copies, 1920
"Sun Yat-sen, Sketches of the Life and Work of the Founder of the Chinese Republic", draft, ca. 1922

"The Faith of the Dare to Dies", typescript, 1929

Economic conditions in China, carbon copy, 1932

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, printed matter, arranged alphabetically by topic.

did.unittitle: American Friends of China Association. Membership cards

Kuomintang. "Kuomintang Meets at Nanking Today", clipping, n.d.

physdesc.extent: (110 prints / 1 album / 73 book illustrations / 1 album of newspaper clippings, (1901-1906

did.unittitle: 6 prints of P.M.W. Linebarger; 1 print of C.C> Cavour Chang; 1 print of Ching H. Chi; 1 print of Lucy Estes Linebarger; 1 print of Mme. Sun Yat-sen; 1 print of Dr. and Mrs. Sun Yat-sen; 1 print of Sun Yat-sen; 27 prints of scenes in China,
41 prints of P.M.W Linebarger; 1 campaign photograph
12 prints of P.M.W Linebarger and others, Santiago Chile and Lima, Peru,
